meanings.definition: Of or relating to schools or education.
meanings.sent1: The scholastic program offers various educational opportunities.
meanings.sent2: She pursued a scholastic career in teaching.
meanings.sent3: The scholastic debate team had a lively discussion about school policies.
meanings.sent4: His scholastic achievements opened doors to higher education.
meanings.sent5: The scholastic environment was conducive to learning.

meanings.definition: A person who is a scholar or student.
meanings.sent1: The young scholar was known for his scholastic abilities.
meanings.sent2: She aspired to become a scholastic and contribute to academia.
meanings.sent3: The scholastic eagerly raised his hand in class to answer questions.
meanings.sent4: The wise old man was a scholastic in his field of study.
meanings.sent5: The library was filled with scholastics engrossed in their books.

meanings.definition: A member of a scholastic society or order.
meanings.sent1: He was initiated as a scholastic into the prestigious society.
meanings.sent2: The scholastic order had strict rules and traditions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scholastic played a prank on his fellow members.
meanings.sent4: She dedicated her life to serving as a scholastic in the order.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scrolls were guarded by the scholastics of the order.
